Looks like this update added more troubles than fixes, my game crashes every single time I engage a trade with any kind of merchant / dealer, with or without mods, NVSE or whatever, doesn't work in any way.

When using the original Skidrow FNV, the game works for me (though it has its crashes, etc.); when using Updates 3 or 4 (I haven't tried 2), characters' skin turns flat pink and other textures get changed. Anyone know how to fix this?

I should clarify: characters' skin is pink, and objects (including ground, clothes, walls, items, etc.) pick up neighboring objects' textures (including pink, if a character's skin is next to the ground or static object).

Follow-up... sorry for the multi-posts - I finally got it to work. If people are having the same problem, go to http://www.thenexusforums.com/index.php?/topic/261613-patch-broke-your-texturesmods/ (even if you don't have any mods loaded). Hopefully it will work (you may need to use the second SArchive list mentioned, if your list has "AII-FNV.bsa" rather than archiveinvalidation). May not work for you, but it did me.

Thanks for the uploads!

One last comment... I just checked and found that Steam is now offering FNV for just $25 for the next day or so. So after all the hassle, I'm gonna buy anyway (but I might not have ever bought it if I didn't play it at length via torrent first!).

I know this has nothing to do with the update, but I posted this in the main upload's comments without response, so possibly someone reading here can help me:

After messing around in the settings, I've realized that there is no way (at least that I can see) to use a joystick rather than the keyboard/mouse. And after playing Fallout 3 on console, I just can't get used to using the keyboard to move around.

The only option I have is to change the buttons for the joystick in the action mapping setting, but it doesn't actually let me choose it.

Someone please help and tell me I'm an idiot for missing something completely obvious :(

@ dxfoleyalf27  There's no really good way to make a 360 controller work with Bethesda games on the PC, but try a program called Xpadder. It's freeware and you can set it up to turn your buttons into keys or mouse movements.

I just recommend getting used to the PC controls though. Been there moving from 360 to PC in Oblivion and it gets easier once you set your own controls and play for a bit.

@Tornd Thanks for the info. It's not that my controller (which is a Logitech more similar to ps3 than xbox, if that matters) doesn't work...it's just that it doesn't even let me choose to select "Joystick", which sucks lol. It just doesn't make any sense.

I'll check out Xpadder and see if it works, and if not, I suppose I'll try and get used to using the keyboard, which for a ps3 user just feels unnatural lol. I appreciate the response, and if you or anyone else has any more help it would be great appreciated!
